SEARCH
Package com.hcltech.authservice.config

Class WebSecurityConfig

java.lang.Object
com.hcltech.authservice.config.WebSecurityConfig
@Configuration @EnableWebSecurity @EnableMethodSecurity(prePostEnabled=true) public class WebSecurityConfig extends Object
Web security configuration class for the Authentication Service.

This configuration class sets up Spring Security with JWT-based authentication, CORS settings, authorization rules, and method-level security. It configures the security filter chain, authentication providers, and initializes default admin user on application startup.

Key features include:

  • Stateless session management using JWT tokens
  • CORS configuration for frontend integration
  • Role-based access control (ADMIN, STUDENT)
  • Public endpoints for registration and login
  • JWT filter integration for token validation
Since:
2025-11-17
Version:
1.0
Author:
Boobesh Kumar S

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • securityFilterChain

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.web.SecurityFilterChain securityFilterChain(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http, MyUserDetailsService userDetailsService, org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder, JwtAuthenticationFilter jwtAuthenticationFilter) throws Exception
      Configures the security filter chain for HTTP security.

      This method sets up the complete security configuration including:

      • CSRF protection disabled for stateless API
      • Stateless session management
      • URL-based authorization rules
      • JWT authentication filter
      • Custom authentication provider
      Parameters:
      http - the HttpSecurity object to configure
      userDetailsService - the custom user details service for loading user data
      passwordEncoder - the password encoder for authentication
      jwtAuthenticationFilter - the JWT filter for token validation
      Returns:
      the configured SecurityFilterChain
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during configuration

    • corsConfigurationSource

      @Bean public org.springframework.web.cors.CorsConfigurationSource corsConfigurationSource()
      Configures CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) settings.

      This configuration allows the React frontend application to communicate with the backend API. It specifies allowed origins, HTTP methods, headers, and enables credentials for cookie-based authentication.

      Returns:
      a CorsConfigurationSource with configured CORS settings

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider authenticationProvider(MyUserDetailsService userDetailsService, org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder)
